intro: Sobralia augusta, commonly known as the golden sobralia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange-yellow inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are broad and leathery, adapted to retain moisture in humid environments. Sobralia augusta is valued in horticulture for its striking appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
